indications:
Indications 
(From Urothelial toxicity: British National Formulary)
Urothelial toxicity
name: MESNA
cautions: Cautions false positive urinary ketones; false positive or false negative urinary erythrocytes
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, colic, diarrhoea, fatigue, headache,
limb and joint pains, depression, irritability, rash, hypotension
and tachycardia; rarely hypersensitivity reactions
(more common in patients with auto-immune disorders)
doses: Calculated according to oxazaphosphorine (cyclophosphamide or ifosfamide) treatment—consult product literature
pregnancy:
Pregnancy not known to be harmful; see also Pregnancy and Reproductive
Function
